author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: Network hurricane expert returns to New Orleans to join FOX 8 -
text:
NEW ORLEANS (WVUE) - WVUE FOX 8 is proud to announce the return of David Bernard to New Orleans' airwaves and digital multimedia. Bernard, a former CBS network hurricane expert, will team up with one of the countryâ€™s leading Meteorologists Bob Breck to bring the most experienced severe weather team to the Gulf Coast. Bernard brings 25 years of forecasting hurricanes in the Gulf to tracking tornadoes in the Midwest.
Bernard comes back to New Orleans after serving as a meteorological consultant in Florida as well as Chief Meteorologist for WFOR the CBS station in Miami. In that role, Bernard became the network's go-to Meteorologist for severe weather appearing as the CBS News hurricane consultant on the CBS Evening News and CBS This Morning. In addition, he contributed to Face the Nation and Sunday Morning. Bernard's network coverage included Hurricanes Gustav, Ike, Isaac, Irene and Sandy.
"I don't think there is anyone more qualified than David to join our team. In Southeast Louisiana, the weather can mean the difference between life and death. We take our responsibility as broadcasters very seriously and David's knowledge and experience with severe weather coupled with his commitment to our community makes David a tremendous asset to our weather team" said longtime FOX 8 Chief Meteorologist Bob Beck.
In 2005, David helped guide South Florida viewers through the record-breaking season of Hurricanes Katrina, Rita and Wilma. He also spent a week in New Orleans reporting on the unfolding Katrina disaster.
"The team at FOX 8 is extremely talented and led by one of the most respected hurricane experts in the country. It's a privilege to work alongside Bob Breck and the rest of the Fox 8 team," said Bernard. "I've always been in love with the city, and it's great to be back home in New Orleans."
Bernard is a familiar face in New Orleans having spent 8 years forecasting the weather here and in 2004, The New Orleans Time Picayune praised David Bernard for his steady voice covering Hurricane Ivan as it hit the Gulf Coast.
Bernard is a member of the American Meteorological Society and National Weather Association. He is a Certified Broadcast Meteorologist (#65) and former member of the AMS Board of Broadcast Meteorology and brings 25 years of broadcasting experience to FOX 8's powerhouse team of meteorologists known for years as "Your Weather Authority."
